cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles W of Cancun, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the southern Gulf today, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast with Louisiana in the bulls-eye late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely between Morgan City and Cameron)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for northern Gulf yet (only Yucatan and parts of Cuba at this time)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for northern Gulf yet (Hurricane & Storm-Surge Watches expected later today)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to the Mississippi-Alabama line
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (65% chance); hurricane-force gusts possible (30% chance of 50-kt, 13% chance of 64-kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge 3–6 ft possible along southeast Louisiana including the Mississippi River delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12-inch totals could cause flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, coastal flooding and the threat of a few tornadoes during outer rain-bands.
